Judge Orders Assistant Director Dave Halls to be Interviewed in Workplace Safety Probe

A New Mexico judge has ordered assistant director Dave Halls to be interviewed by state workplace safety regulators in connection with the death of a cinematographer on the Bonanza Creek Ranch film set near Santa Fe.

The Occupational Health and Safety Bureau of the state Environment Department issued a subpoena to Halls, who had declined two previous requests for an interview, citing the ongoing criminal investigation.

Halls handed Alec Baldwin the prop gun that resulted in Halyna Hutchins' death on October 21.

Baldwin was not charged in the incident, but Halls could face criminal charges for his role in the tragedy.

Interior Department to Investigate Its Role in Capitol Riot

With the deaths of five people and the upcoming presidential inauguration in mind, the Interior Department's Office of Inspector General has announced an investigation into the department's role in the Jan. 6 Capitol riot.

The investigation will be coordinated with parallel probes by the inspectors general of the Department of Defense, Department of Homeland Security, and Department of Justice.

The Interior Department includes the National Park Service and U.S. Park Police, both of which have law enforcement responsibilities.

Representatives from the Park Police and National Park Service have not commented on the investigation.

Fake News: Kyle Rittenhouse Did Not Have a 'Two-Week, All-Expenses-Paid Vacation' at Mar-a-Lago

However, Rittenhouse did visit Florida and Mar-a-Lago the weekend after his trial for an interview and met former President Donald Trump.

Trump confirmed he met Rittenhouse and his mother at Mar-a-Lago, stating Rittenhouse was a fan and wanted to say hello.

Oxford Community School District Faces $100 Million Lawsuit After Shooting

The parents of two victims and a survivor of the Oxford High School shooting have filed a lawsuit against the school district and its officials, seeking $100 million in damages. The shooting, carried out by a 15-year-old, resulted in the death of four students and injury of seven others, including a teacher. The lawsuit accuses the school district's superintendent, principal, and other staff of failing to act on prior knowledge of the shooter's threatening behavior. The shooter's parents are charged with involuntary manslaughter for providing him with a gun and ignoring warning signs. Riley Franz, 17, who was injured in the shooting, and her sister Bella, 14, are represented in the lawsuit.

Microsoft Flight Simulator Mod Adds Suez Canal Traffic Jam

The Ever Given is a ship that got stuck in the Suez Canal, causing a major disruption to global trade. Thanks to the efforts of tugboats, the ship has been freed and the Suez Canal is once again open for business. But the drama doesn't end there â€“ thanks to some enterprising modders, the Ever Given has been added to Microsoft Flight Simulator, where it can be recreated in all its real-life glory.

The mod, created by FlyBoyRez1 and inspired by Zepingouin35, replicates the Suez Canal traffic jam with stunning accuracy. It features the Ever Given, surrounded by realistic traffic and parked boats in the Suez Gulf, as well as attempts by tugboats to free the ship. The modders have even replicated the real-life conditions of the traffic jam, with the ship being just wide enough to impede the passage of other ships.

The addition of the Ever Given to Microsoft Flight Simulator is an impressive feat of realism and creativity. Whether you're a fan of the original event or a simulation enthusiast, it's sure to provide hours of enjoyment.

Violence Against Women Act (VAWA) is a federal law that provides protection to victims of domestic violence, dating violence, sexual assault, and stalking. VAWA also provides funding for training, education, and services for victims and their families.

In 2013, Congress reauthorized VAWA, but certain provisions of the law expired in 2021. The House of Representatives recently passed a bill to extend the expired provisions of VAWA, but the Senate has yet to take action.

The expired provisions of VAWA include the Safe at Home program, which helps victims of domestic violence, dating violence, and stalking who have been terminated from their residences or fear for their safety. The bill also includes provisions to help American Indian and Alaska Native victims, as well as provisions for trafficking victims.

It is important for the Senate to take action and extend these expired provisions of VAWA in order to provide continued protection for victims of domestic violence, dating violence, sexual assault, and stalking.

The SEC has sent investigative letters to companies asking for voluntary information on hack effects and disclosure failures. The probe focuses on whether affected companies had lapses in internal controls and issues related to insider trading.

The SEC's press office has declined to comment on the investigation.

Citibank Accidentally Transfers $890 Million to Revlon's Lenders - Judge Rules Banks Cannot Recover Mistakenly Wired Funds

The funds were sent to 10 investment advisory firms, with $500 million still unrecovered. New York law has a "discharge-for-value-defense" allowing beneficiaries to keep money if entitled and unaware it was sent accidentally.
